options.message: A manutenção do hardware subjacente das instâncias Amazon EC2 é responsabilidade da AWS, não do cliente.

A segurança dos dados da aplicação é uma responsabilidade do cliente no modelo de responsabilidade compartilhada da AWS. A AWS é responsável pela segurança da nuvem, enquanto os clientes são responsáveis pela segurança na nuvem.
A segurança física dos data centers é responsabilidade da AWS, não do cliente.
A manutenção dos componentes do VPC é uma responsabilidade compartilhada entre a AWS e o cliente.

pt.question: Qual dos seguintes é um banco de dados compatível com MySQL totalmente gerenciado?

options.message: Amazon DynamoDB não é um banco de dados compatível com MySQL totalmente gerenciado.
Amazon Redshift não é um banco de dados compatível com MySQL totalmente gerenciado.
Amazon Aurora é um banco de dados compatível com MySQL totalmente gerenciado.
Amazon S3 não é um banco de dados compatível com MySQL totalmente gerenciado.

pt.question: Qual serviço ou recurso da AWS melhora o desempenho da rede ao enviar tráfego pela infraestrutura de rede mundial da AWS?

options.message: Incorreto. As tabelas de rotas são usadas em VPCs para controlar o roteamento do tráfego de rede.
Incorreto. O AWS Transit Gateway é um serviço que simplifica a conectividade de rede entre VPCs, VPNs e redes locais.
Incorreto. O Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) permite lançar recursos da AWS em uma rede virtual.
Correto. O AWS Global Accelerator melhora a disponibilidade e o desempenho de seus aplicativos com usuários locais ou globais, roteando o tráfego pela infraestrutura de rede global da AWS.

pt.question: Você precisa implementar na sua conta, uma forma de facilitar a liberação de acessos para o seu time de desenvolvimento e para colaboradores que ingressarem nele. Como você pode realizar isso?

options.option: Fazendo uso do AWS IAM Grupos para criar um grupo de desenvolvedores e para fazer a gestão de acessos.
options.message: Correta! O AWS IAM Grupos permite que você crie grupos para gerenciar melhor e de forma mais ágil a liberação de acesso a determinados perfis de colaboradores.

options.option: Fazendo uso AWS Federation para criar um grupo de desenvolvedores e para fazer a gestão de acessos.
options.message: Incorreta. AWS Federation é utilizado para integrar processos de autenticação de terceiros com a AWS.

options.option: Fazendo o uso de Roles para criar um grupo de desenvolvedores e para fazer a gestão de acessos.
options.message: Incorreta. Roles são tipos de identidades criados no IAM para que as aplicações ou serviços possam receber autorização para acessar outras aplicações ou serviços.

options.option: Fazendo o uso da AWS SDK que permite o gerenciamento de todos os desenvolvedores de forma automática
options.message: Incorreta. A AWS SDK é uma plataforma de desenvolvimento que acelera o processo de desenvolvimento de software na AWS, mas o acesso tem que ser concedido pelo IAM.

pt.question: Uma empresa está explorando o uso da AWS Cloud e precisa criar uma estimativa de custo para um projeto antes que a infraestrutura seja provisionada. Qual serviço ou recurso da AWS pode ser usado para estimar os custos antes da implantação?

options.message: Incorreto. O Nível Gratuito da AWS fornece uso gratuito limitado para determinados serviços da AWS, mas não é adequado para estimar custos para um projeto específico.

options.option: Faturamento e Gerenciamento de Custos da AWS
options.message: Incorreto. O Faturamento e Gerenciamento de Custos da AWS fornece ferramentas para monitorar, gerenciar e otimizar seus custos da AWS após a implantação, mas não ajuda a estimar custos antes da implantação.
Correto. A Calculadora de Preços da AWS permite estimar os custos de uso dos serviços da AWS com base nos padrões de uso, configurações e requisitos antes de implantar qualquer infraestrutura.

options.option: Relatório de Custos e Uso da AWS
options.message: Incorreto. O Relatório de Custos e Uso da AWS fornece dados abrangentes de custos e uso para sua conta da AWS, mas não é adequado para estimar custos antes da implantação.

pt.question: Por que a AWS é mais econômica do que os data centers tradicionais para aplicativos com cargas de trabalho de computação variáveis?

options.option: Os custos da Amazon EC2 são cobrados mensalmente.
options.message: Incorreto. A cobrança mensal pode não estar alinhada com as cargas de trabalho de computação variáveis.

options.option: As instâncias da Amazon EC2 podem ser lançadas sob demanda quando necessário.
options.message: Correto! O lançamento sob demanda de instâncias está alinhado com as demandas de carga de trabalho variáveis, permitindo otimização de custos.

options.option: Os usuários podem executar permanentemente instâncias suficientes para lidar com cargas de trabalho de pico.
options.message: Incorreto. A execução permanente de instâncias pode levar à subutilização e aumento dos custos.

options.option: Os usuários mantêm acesso administrativo total às suas instâncias da Amazon EC2.
options.message: Incorreto. O acesso administrativo não está diretamente relacionado à eficiência de custos.

pt.question: Uma empresa planeja migrar para a AWS Cloud. A empresa quer usar o AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) para definir e acompanhar os resultados comerciais como parte de sua jornada de transformação na nuvem. Qual capacidade de perspectiva de governança do AWS CAF atenderá a esses requisitos?

options.message: O gerenciamento do portfólio de aplicativos trata da gestão do portfólio de aplicativos, mas não aborda diretamente a definição e o acompanhamento dos resultados comerciais.
O gerenciamento de riscos concentra-se em identificar e mitigar os riscos associados à adoção da nuvem, mas não aborda diretamente a definição e o acompanhamento dos resultados comerciais.
O gerenciamento financeiro na nuvem envolve a gestão de finanças relacionadas à nuvem, mas não aborda diretamente a definição e o acompanhamento dos resultados comerciais.
O gerenciamento de benefícios é a capacidade correta. Permite definir e acompanhar os resultados comerciais como parte da jornada de transformação na nuvem.

pt.question: Qual dos seguintes é um princípio de design recomendado para arquitetura de nuvem da AWS?

options.option: Evitar arquitetura monolítica segmentando cargas de trabalho.
options.message: Evitar arquitetura monolítica segmentando cargas de trabalho é um princípio de design recomendado para arquitetura de nuvem da AWS. Isso promove escalabilidade, flexibilidade e resiliência.
Incorreto. Projetar componentes fortemente acoplados pode aumentar a complexidade e diminuir a flexibilidade na arquitetura de nuvem da AWS.

options.option: Fazer grandes mudanças em menos iterações para reduzir as chances de falha.
options.message: Incorreto. Fazer grandes mudanças com pouca frequência pode aumentar o risco de falhas e dificultar a recuperação de problemas.

options.option: Construir um único componente de aplicativo que possa lidar com toda a funcionalidade do aplicativo.
options.message: Incorreto. Construir um único componente monolítico vai contra as melhores práticas modernas para arquiteturas de nuvem escaláveis e de fácil manutenção.

pt.question: Na implementação de uma estratégia de backups, qual é número máximo de snapshots manuais de RDS permitidas por região?

options.option: o número de cópia é virtualmente ilimitado
options.message: Incorreta. Na verdade, existe um limite para o número de snapshots manuais de RDS que você pode ter por região.
Correta! Este é o número máximo de snapshots manuais de RDS permitidas por região.
Incorreta. O número máximo de snapshots manuais de RDS permitidas por região é menor do que 256.
Incorreta. O número máximo de snapshots manuais de RDS permitidas por região é maior do que 128.

pt.question: Quais são os benefícios da faturação consolidada para os serviços da AWS na nuvem? (Escolha duas opções.)

options.message: Correto. A faturação consolidada permite descontos por volume, agregando o uso de várias contas.
Incorreto. As opções de pagamento parcelado não estão diretamente relacionadas à faturação consolidada.

options.option: Uma taxa adicional mínima de uso
options.message: Incorreto. Pode haver taxas adicionais associadas à faturação consolidada, mas elas não são mínimas.

options.option: Criação de orçamento personalizado de custos e uso
options.message: Incorreto. Embora existam recursos de orçamento disponíveis, eles não são exclusivos da faturação consolidada.
Correto. A faturação consolidada permite uma fatura para várias contas, simplificando o processo de faturação.

pt.question: Algumas aplicações críticas da sua empresa começaram a apresentar erros e, por falta de logs, a equipe de suporte está tendo dificuldade na resolução dos problemas. Qual serviço da AWS você recomendaria para monitorar o ambiente e coletar as logs?

options.message: Incorreta. AWS Log não é um serviço existente na AWS.

Correta! O Amazon CloudWatch é um serviço de monitoramento e observabilidade criado para engenheiros de DevOps, desenvolvedores, engenheiros de confiabilidade de sites (SREs), gerentes de Tl e proprietários de produtos.
Incorreta. O CloudTrail é utilizado para logar as ações em APIs de serviços da AWS como Start/Stop de uma instância EC2, entre outros.
Incorreta. AWS Monitor não é um serviço existente na AWS.

en.question: A development team needs to store database credentials for a web application that will run on Amazon EC2. The credentials must be stored securely and need to be rotated automatically. Which solution is the best to meet these requirements?

options.option: Store the credentials in environment variables on the EC2 instance and update them manually.
options.message: Incorrect. Storing credentials in environment variables does not provide a secure or automated method for rotating credentials.

options.option: Hard-code the credentials directly into the application's source code and update the code whenever the credentials need to be changed.
options.message: Incorrect. Hard-coding credentials in the source code is an insecure practice and does not facilitate automatic rotation.

options.option: Use AWS Secrets Manager to store the credentials and enable automatic rotation.
options.message: Correct. AWS Secrets Manager is designed to securely store secrets and supports the automatic rotation of credentials with minimal operational overhead.

options.option: Store the credentials in a text file in an Amazon S3 bucket with versioning enabled.
options.message: Incorrect. While versioning might help, Amazon S3 does not offer automatic rotation of credentials.

en.question: A company wants to run its critical applications in containers to meet scalability and availability requirements. The company prefers to focus on maintaining critical applications and does not want to be responsible for provisioning and managing the underlying infrastructure that runs the container workload. What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.option: Use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) on AWS Fargate.
options.message: Correct. This is the correct option because AWS Fargate allows you to run containers without managing servers or EC2 clusters, enabling the company to focus on application maintenance.

options.option: Use Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) on Amazon EC2 worker nodes.
options.message: Incorrect. Although this option uses Amazon ECS, it still requires management of the underlying EC2 instances, which the company wants to avoid.

options.option: Use Amazon EC2 instances from an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) optimized for Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS).
options.message: Incorrect. This option requires the company to manage the underlying infrastructure, which does not meet the requirement to avoid this responsibility.

options.option: Use Amazon EC2 instances and install Docker on the instances.
options.message: Incorrect. This option requires complete management of infrastructure and software, which is not aligned with the company's goal of minimizing infrastructure responsibility.

en.question: What is the recommended IAM policy for granting read-only access to CloudWatch?

options.message: Incorrect. The ViewOnlyAccess policy provides access to more resources than necessary and is not specific to CloudWatch.
Incorrect. This policy grants full permissions to CloudWatch, which is more than necessary for read-only access.
Correct. This policy grants read-only permissions to CloudWatch, ideal for viewing dashboards without making changes.
Incorrect. This policy is for read-only access to Amazon EC2, not to CloudWatch.

en.question: A company runs an e-commerce application on Amazon EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer. The instances run in an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group across multiple Availability Zones. The Auto Scaling group scales based on CPU utilization metrics. The e-commerce application stores transaction data in a MySQL 8.0 database hosted on a large EC2 instance. Database performance degrades quickly as application load increases. The application handles more read requests than write transactions. The company wants a solution that automatically scales the database to meet unpredictable read workload demand while maintaining high availability. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Use Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached with EC2 spot instances.
options.message: Incorrect. ElastiCache for Memcached is not a complete database solution and does not guarantee data persistence and scalability like Aurora.

options.option: Use Amazon Aurora with a Multi-AZ deployment. Configure Aurora Auto Scaling with Aurora Replicas.
options.message: Correct. Amazon Aurora Multi-AZ with Auto Scaling is suitable for handling higher read load, providing high availability and automatic scaling.

options.option: Use Amazon RDS with a Single-AZ deployment. Configure Amazon RDS to add reader instances in a different Availability Zone.
options.message: Incorrect. RDS Single-AZ does not provide adequate high availability, and managing read replicas manually adds operational complexity.

options.option: Use Amazon Redshift with a single node for leader and compute functionality.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon Redshift is not suitable for transactional workloads and high availability required for a MySQL database.

en.question: What is the main advantage of using Amazon EFS to store documents accessible by multiple EC2 instances?

options.message: Incorrect. Amazon EFS is a shared file system, not block storage.
Incorrect. Although Amazon EFS is useful for file sharing, the cost may be higher compared to block storage.

options.option: Shared storage accessible by multiple EC2 instances.
options.message: Correct. Amazon EFS is a file system that can be mounted by multiple EC2 instances simultaneously, ensuring shared access to documents.
Incorrect. Amazon EFS does not provide computing capacity, but rather shared storage.

en.question: A company is launching a new application and will display application metrics on an Amazon CloudWatch dashboard. The company's product manager needs to access this dashboard periodically. The product manager does not have an AWS account. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Deploy a bastion server in a public subnet. When the product manager requires access to the dashboard, start the server and share the RDP credentials. On the bastion server, ensure the browser is configured to open the dashboard URL with cached AWS credentials that have appropriate permissions to view the dashboard.
options.message: Incorrect. This approach is overly complex and insecure. Using a bastion server for access to a specific dashboard is unnecessary and does not follow the principle of least privilege.

options.option: Share the dashboard in the CloudWatch console. Enter the product manager's email address and complete the sharing steps. Provide a shareable link to the dashboard to the product manager.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon CloudWatch does not support direct sharing of dashboards via email. Dashboard access must be managed through IAM permissions.

options.option: Create an IAM user for the company's employees. Attach the AWS-managed policy ViewOnlyAccess to the IAM user. Share the new login credentials with the product manager. Instruct the product manager to navigate to the CloudWatch console and locate the dashboard by name in the Dashboards section.
options.message: Incorrect. The ViewOnlyAccess policy provides access to more resources than necessary, and the product manager would have to manually search for the dashboard, which may not be ideal.

options.option: Create an IAM user specifically for the product manager. Attach the AWS-managed policy CloudWatchReadOnlyAccess to the user. Share the new login credentials with the product manager. Share the browser URL of the correct dashboard with the product manager.
options.message: Correct. This option follows the principle of least privilege, providing the product manager with read-only access to CloudWatch and ensuring they can view the necessary dashboard.

en.question: Which AWS service provides durable and highly available storage for frequently accessed data?

options.message: Correct. Amazon S3 provides durable and highly available storage for frequently accessed data.
Incorrect. Amazon EC2 provides computing resources, not durable and highly available storage by itself.
Incorrect. Amazon Lambda is a serverless compute service, not a storage service.
Incorrect. Amazon RDS is a managed database service, but Amazon S3 is more suitable for durable file storage.

en.question: A company's website uses Amazon EC2 instance storage for its item catalog. The company wants to ensure that the catalog is highly available and stored in a durable location. What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.option: Move the catalog to Amazon ElastiCache for Redis.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon ElastiCache for Redis is an in-memory cache and is not suitable for durable storage.

options.option: Move the catalog to an Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS).
options.message: Correct. Amazon EFS offers high availability and durability, suitable for file storage.

options.option: Deploy a larger EC2 instance with larger instance storage.
options.message: Incorrect. Increasing the instance size does not ensure high availability or storage durability.

options.option: Move the catalog from instance storage to Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon S3 Glacier Deep Archive is intended for long-term archiving, not high availability.

en.question: A company is developing an application that provides order shipment statistics for retrieval by a REST API. The company wants to extract the shipment statistics, organize the data into an easy-to-read HTML format, and send the report to multiple email addresses at the same time every morning. What combination of steps should a solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

options.option: Store the application data in Amazon S3. Create an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic as an S3 event destination to send the report by email.
options.message: Incorrect. Storing data in S3 and using SNS does not provide the HTML formatting and sending logic required for daily reports.

options.option: Use Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES) to format the data and send the report by email.
options.message: Correct. Amazon SES is suitable for sending emails and can format the data into HTML easily.

options.option: Create an Amazon EventBridge (Amazon CloudWatch Events) scheduled event that invokes an AWS Lambda function to query the data from the application's API.
options.message: Correct. EventBridge can schedule daily events and Lambda can query the API and perform the necessary logic to create the report.

options.option: Configure the application to send the data to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
options.message: Incorrect. Kinesis Data Firehose is used to deliver data to target stores, but not for retrieving and organizing specific data.

en.question: A company is designing an application. The application uses an AWS Lambda function to receive information through Amazon API Gateway and store it in an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL database. During the proof of concept phase, the company needs to significantly increase Lambda quotas to handle the high volumes of data the company needs to load into the database. What solution should a solutions architect recommend to improve scalability and minimize configuration effort?

options.option: Refactor the Lambda function code to Apache Tomcat code running on Amazon EC2 instances. Connect to the database using native JDBC (Java Database Connectivity) drivers.
options.message: Incorrect. Running code on EC2 with Apache Tomcat increases configuration and maintenance effort and does not optimize scalability.

options.option: Change the Aurora platform to Amazon DynamoDB and provision a DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) cluster. Use the DAX client SDK to point existing DynamoDB API calls to the DAX cluster.
options.message: Incorrect. Changing the database platform to DynamoDB is unnecessary and does not meet the requirements of using Aurora PostgreSQL.

options.option: Configure two Lambda functions. Configure one function to receive the information. Configure the other function to load the information into the database. Integrate the Lambda functions using Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).
options.message: Incorrect. Using SNS may introduce additional latency and unnecessary complexity without significantly increasing scalability.

options.option: Configure two Lambda functions. Configure one function to receive the information. Configure the other function to load the information into the database. Integrate the Lambda functions using an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue.
options.message: Correct. Using two Lambda functions integrated with SQS improves scalability by decoupling data reception and loading, resulting in a more efficient and easily configurable solution.

en.question: A solutions architect is designing a VPC architecture that includes multiple subnets. The architecture will host applications that use Amazon EC2 instances and Amazon RDS database instances. The architecture consists of six subnets in two Availability Zones. Each Availability Zone includes a public subnet, a private subnet, and a subnet dedicated to databases. Only EC2 instances running in the private subnets can access the RDS databases. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Create a new route table that excludes the route to the public subnet CIDR blocks. Associate the route table with the database subnets.
options.message: Incorrect. Excluding CIDR routes does not directly prevent access from the public subnets to the database instances.

options.option: Create a security group that denies inbound traffic from the security group assigned to instances in the public subnets. Attach the security group to the database instances.
options.message: Incorrect. This approach does not prevent all traffic, as security group rules can be modified.

options.option: Create a new peering connection between the public subnets and the private subnets. Create a different peering connection between the private subnets and the database subnets.
options.message: Incorrect. VPC peering connections are unnecessary and complex for this use case.

options.option: Create a security group that allows inbound traffic from the security group assigned to instances in the private subnets. Attach the security group to the database instances.
options.message: Correct. Configuring security groups this way limits access to the database instances to only the instances in the private subnets.

en.question: Which of the following AWS services offers automatic secret rotation functionality without manual intervention?

options.message: Correct. AWS Secrets Manager natively supports automatic secret rotation, facilitating the management and security of credentials without manual intervention.
Incorrect. Although AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store supports parameter encryption, automatic rotation must be implemented manually.
Incorrect. AWS CloudFormation is used to define and provision infrastructure, not to manage secret rotation.
Incorrect. Amazon S3 is a storage service and does not provide support for automatic secret rotation.

en.question: A company needs to review its AWS cloud deployment to ensure that its Amazon S3 buckets do not have unauthorized configuration changes. What should a solutions architect do to achieve this goal?

options.option: Enable Amazon S3 server access logging. Configure Amazon EventBridge (Amazon CloudWatch Events).
options.message: Incorrect. S3 server access logging and EventBridge can monitor access but do not ensure detection of unauthorized configuration changes.

options.option: Enable AWS Config with appropriate rules.
options.message: Correct. AWS Config with appropriate rules can monitor and assess S3 configurations to detect unauthorized changes.

options.option: Enable Amazon Inspector with the appropriate assessment template.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon Inspector is designed for security and vulnerability assessment, not for monitoring changes in S3 configuration.

options.option: Enable AWS Trusted Advisor with appropriate checks.
options.message: Incorrect. AWS Trusted Advisor can help identify best practice violations but does not specifically monitor changes in S3 configuration.

en.question: A company is implementing a new business application. The application runs on two Amazon EC2 instances and uses an Amazon S3 bucket for document storage. A solutions architect needs to ensure that the EC2 instances can access the S3 bucket. What should the solutions architect do to meet this requirement?

options.option: Create an IAM group that grants access to the S3 bucket. Attach the group to the EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. IAM groups cannot be directly attached to EC2 instances to provide permissions.

options.option: Create an IAM group that grants access to the S3 bucket. Attach the group to the EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. IAM groups cannot be directly attached to EC2 instances to provide permissions.

options.option: Create an IAM role that grants access to the S3 bucket. Attach the role to the EC2 instances.
options.message: Correct. Attaching an IAM role to EC2 instances is the best practice for granting access to S3.

options.option: Create an IAM policy that grants access to the S3 bucket. Attach the policy to the EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. IAM policies cannot be directly attached to EC2 instances; they must be applied to IAM roles.

en.question: A solutions architect is using Amazon S3 to design the storage architecture for a new digital media application. The media files must be resilient to the loss of an availability zone. Some files are accessed frequently, while others are rarely accessed with unpredictable patterns. The solutions architect needs to minimize the storage and retrieval costs for the media files. What storage option meets these requirements?

options.message: Correct. S3 Intelligent-Tiering is ideal for data with unpredictable access patterns and minimizes costs by moving data between frequent and infrequent access tiers as needed.
Incorrect. S3 Standard-IA is suitable for data accessed rarely but is not ideal for data with unpredictable access patterns, as described in the case.

options.option: S3 One Zone-Infrequent Access (S3 One Zone-IA)
options.message: Incorrect. S3 One Zone-IA is less expensive but data stored in this storage class is not resilient to the loss of an availability zone, which does not meet the resilience requirement.
Incorrect. S3 Standard is more expensive than necessary for rarely accessed files and is not optimized to minimize costs for unpredictable access patterns.

en.question: A company runs a popular social media website. The site gives users the ability to upload images to share with other users. The company wants to ensure that the images do not contain inappropriate content. The company needs a solution that minimizes development effort. What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.option: Use Amazon Comprehend to detect inappropriate content. Use human review for low-confidence predictions.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon Comprehend is better suited for natural language processing, not image analysis.

options.option: Use Amazon SageMaker to detect inappropriate content. Use ground truth to label low-confidence predictions.
options.message: Incorrect. Using Amazon SageMaker would require significant development effort to build, train, and deploy the model, along with managing the labeling and validation of low-confidence predictions.

options.option: Use AWS Fargate to deploy a custom machine learning model to detect inappropriate content. Use ground truth to label low-confidence predictions.
options.message: Incorrect. Using AWS Fargate to manage container infrastructure does not directly solve the inappropriate image detection problem and would require additional development to create and train a custom model.

options.option: Use Amazon Rekognition to detect inappropriate content. Use human review for low-confidence predictions.
options.message: Correct. Amazon Rekognition is a managed service that makes it easier to detect inappropriate content in images, requiring less development effort and can be supplemented with human review for low-confidence predictions.

en.question: If an application needs to handle a high volume of reads and writes to a relational database and cannot tolerate downtime, which database configuration should be considered?

options.option: Deploy Amazon RDS with a single instance and daily backups.
options.message: Incorrect. A single instance does not offer high availability and may not support a high volume of reads and writes without downtime.

options.option: Use Amazon Aurora with read replicas and Multi-AZ configuration.
options.message: Correct. Amazon Aurora with read replicas and Multi-AZ configuration offers high availability and scalability for high volumes of read and write operations.

options.option: Implement an in-memory cache solution using Amazon ElastiCache.
options.message: Incorrect. An in-memory cache can improve read performance, but it does not address high availability and scalability issues for a relational database.

options.option: Utilize Amazon DynamoDB with provisioned capacity for reads and writes.
options.message: Incorrect. Although DynamoDB is highly scalable and can handle high volumes, it is not a relational database and may not be the best choice for applications requiring a relational database.

en.question: A company hosts a data lake on AWS. The data lake consists of data in Amazon S3 and Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL. The company needs a reporting solution that provides data visualization and includes all data sources within the data lake. Only the company's management team should have full access to all visualizations. The rest of the company should have limited access. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Create an analysis in Amazon QuickSight. Connect all data sources and create new datasets. Publish dashboards to visualize the data. Share the dashboards with the appropriate users and groups.
options.message: Correct. Amazon QuickSight allows for the creation and sharing of interactive dashboards with proper access control, providing effective visualizations for different access levels.

options.option: Create an analysis in Amazon QuickSight. Connect all data sources and create new datasets. Publish dashboards to visualize the data. Share the dashboards with appropriate IAM roles.
options.message: Incorrect. Sharing dashboards with IAM roles does not offer the full granularity and flexibility needed for a management environment.

options.option: Create an AWS Glue table and crawler for the data in Amazon S3. Use Amazon Athena Federated Query to access data in Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL. Generate reports using Amazon Athena. Publish the reports to Amazon S3. Use S3 bucket policies to limit access to the reports.
options.message: Incorrect. This option also provides access control, but it is not the most efficient solution for full data visualization with interactive capabilities.

options.option: Create an AWS Glue table and crawler for the data in Amazon S3. Create an AWS Glue extract, transform, and load (ETL) job to produce reports. Publish the reports to Amazon S3. Use S3 bucket policies to limit access to the reports.
options.message: Incorrect. While AWS Glue and bucket policies can control access, this solution does not provide the best data visualization with full access controls.

en.question: What VPC configuration is necessary to ensure that traffic between a web application in a public subnet and a firewall device in a private subnet passes through the firewall for inspection?

options.option: Add an entry in the web server's security group allowing all traffic from the firewall device.
options.message: Incorrect. Modifying the web server's security group does not ensure traffic passes through the firewall inspection, it only allows traffic to reach the web server.

options.option: Create a VPC Endpoint to connect the public subnet to the firewall device's private subnet.
options.message: Incorrect. A VPC Endpoint is used to connect the VPC to AWS services, not for routing and inspecting traffic between internal subnets.

options.option: Set up a VPN connection between the application VPC and the firewall device VPC.
options.message: Incorrect. A VPN connection is not needed for internal traffic inspection between subnets within the same VPC.

options.option: Add a route in the public subnet's route table pointing to the firewall device.
options.message: Correct. Adding a route in the public subnet's route table directs traffic to the firewall device, ensuring it passes through inspection before reaching the web server.

en.question: A company is hosting a web application on AWS using a single Amazon EC2 instance that stores user-uploaded documents in an Amazon EBS volume. For better scalability and availability, the company duplicated the architecture and created a second EC2 instance and an EBS volume in another availability zone, placing both behind an Application Load Balancer. After making this change, users reported that each time they refreshed the site, they could see one subset of their documents or another, but never all documents at once. What should a solutions architect propose to ensure that users see all of their documents at once?

options.option: Copy the data so that both EBS volumes contain all the documents.
options.message: Incorrect. Copying data to both EBS volumes does not solve the problem of sharing states across different availability zones efficiently and automatically.

options.option: Configure the Application Load Balancer to direct a user to the server with the documents.
options.message: Incorrect. The Application Load Balancer does not have the capability to direct users to specific instances based on stored documents.

options.option: Copy the data from both EBS volumes to Amazon EFS. Modify the application to save new documents in Amazon EFS.
options.message: Correct. Using Amazon EFS allows sharing the file system across multiple EC2 instances, ensuring that all instances can access the same documents.

options.option: Configure the Application Load Balancer to send the request to both servers. Return each document from the correct server.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution is complex and inefficient.

en.question: What is the main advantage of Amazon S3 over Amazon EC2 instance storage?

options.message: Correct. Amazon S3 offers high availability and durability, which is not guaranteed by EC2 instance storage.
Incorrect. Amazon S3 is a storage service and not related to processing capacity.
Incorrect. Amazon S3 may have higher latency compared to local EC2 instance storage.
Incorrect. Although Amazon S3 offers large storage capacity, EC2 instance storage can be configured to meet specific needs.

en.question: An application development team is designing a microservice that will convert large images into smaller, compressed images. When a user uploads an image through the web interface, the microservice should store the image in an Amazon S3 bucket, process and compress the image with an AWS Lambda function, and store the image in its compressed form in a different S3 bucket. A solutions architect needs to design a solution that uses durable, stateless components to automatically process the images. Which combination of actions will meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

options.option: Configure the Lambda function to use the Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue as the invocation source. When the SQS message is processed successfully, delete the message from the queue.
options.message: Correct. Using SQS as an invocation source for the Lambda function ensures durability and automatic processing of the messages.

options.option: Start an Amazon EC2 instance to monitor an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. When items are added to the queue, log the file name to a text file on the EC2 instance and invoke the Lambda function.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution adds complexity and state monitoring, which is unnecessary for an automated and durable workflow.

options.option: Create an Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) queue. Configure the S3 bucket to send a notification to the SQS queue when an image is uploaded to the S3 bucket.
options.message: Correct. Sending S3 notifications to an SQS queue automates the workflow and ensures durability and delivery of the messages.

options.option: Configure an Amazon EventBridge (Amazon CloudWatch Events) event to monitor the S3 bucket. When an image is uploaded, send an alert to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic with the application owner's email address for further processing.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution is not ideal because it adds unnecessary complexity to the workflow.

en.question: A company has a production workload running on 1,000 Amazon EC2 Linux instances. The workload is powered by third-party software. The company needs to patch the third-party software on all EC2 instances as quickly as possible to fix a critical security vulnerability. What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.option: Create an AWS Lambda function to apply the patch to all EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. Lambda is not suitable for managing large-scale patch application across 1,000 EC2 instances.

options.option: Use AWS Systems Manager Run Command to run a custom command that applies the patch to all EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. Run Command is efficient for single commands but not for the centralized and orderly management needed with urgency.

options.option: Schedule an AWS Systems Manager maintenance window to apply the patch to all EC2 instances.
options.message: Correct. Systems Manager maintenance window provides orderly patching with minimal downtime and ensures all instances are patched quickly.

options.option: Configure AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager to apply the patch to all EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. Patch Manager is for applying patches to the OS and is not suitable for patching third-party software in one go.

en.question: A company registered its domain name with Amazon Route 53. The company uses Amazon API Gateway in the ca-central-1 region as a public interface for its backend microservice APIs. Third-party services securely consume the APIs. The company wants to design its API Gateway URL with the company's domain name and corresponding certificate so that third-party services can use HTTPS. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Create stage variables in API Gateway with Name="Endpoint-URL" and Value="Company Domain Name" to override the default URL. Import the public certificate associated with the company's domain name into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
options.message: Incorrect. Stage Variables are not used for certificates and do not provide a complete solution for HTTPS configuration and custom domain setup.

options.option: Create a Regional API Gateway endpoint. Associate the API Gateway endpoint with the company's domain name. Import the public certificate associated with the company's domain name into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) in the us-east-1 region. Attach the certificate to the API Gateway APIs. Create Route 53 DNS records with the company's domain name. Point an A record to the company's domain name.
options.message: Incorrect. The certificate needs to be in the same region as the API Gateway, which is ca-central-1, not us-east-1.

options.option: Create a Regional API Gateway endpoint. Associate the API Gateway endpoint with the company's domain name. Import the public certificate associated with the company's domain name into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) in the same region. Attach the certificate to the API Gateway endpoint. Configure Route 53 to route traffic to the API Gateway endpoint.
options.message: Correct. This ensures that the certificate is in the same ca-central-1 region and that the domain name and HTTPS configuration work correctly.

options.option: Create Route 53 DNS records with the company's domain name. Point the alias record to the Regional API Gateway stage endpoint. Import the public certificate associated with the company's domain name into AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) in the us-east-1 region.
options.message: Incorrect. Again, the certificate needs to be in the same region as the API Gateway, which is ca-central-1, not us-east-1.

en.question: A company is hosting a web application on AWS using a single Amazon EC2 instance that stores user-uploaded documents in an Amazon EBS volume. For better scalability and availability, the company duplicated the architecture and created a second EC2 instance and an EBS volume in another availability zone, placing both behind an Application Load Balancer. After making this change, users reported that each time they refreshed the site, they could see one subset of their documents or another, but never all documents at once. What should a solutions architect propose to ensure users see all of their documents at once?

options.option: Copy the data so that both EBS volumes contain all the documents.
options.message: Incorrect. EBS volumes are specific to each EC2 instance and do not automatically synchronize. This does not solve the document inconsistency problem.

options.option: Configure the Application Load Balancer to direct a user to the server with the documents.
options.message: Incorrect. It is not possible to direct traffic to a specific server based on stored content. The solution does not resolve the document synchronization problem.

options.option: Copy the data from both EBS volumes to Amazon EFS. Modify the application to save new documents in Amazon EFS.
options.message: Correct. Amazon EFS provides a shared file system that can be mounted on multiple EC2 instances, ensuring that all documents are accessible to both instances.

options.option: Configure the Application Load Balancer to send the request to both servers. Return each document from the correct server.
options.message: Incorrect. This is not a viable approach, as the Application Load Balancer cannot guarantee that all documents are synchronized between servers.

en.question: What action should be taken to ensure that the Application Load Balancer (ALB) automatically redirects all unsecured traffic to a secure connection?

options.option: Create a redirect rule on the HTTP listener to direct traffic to the HTTPS listener.
options.message: Correct. Creating a redirect rule on the HTTP listener to direct traffic to the HTTPS listener is the correct action to ensure a secure connection.

options.option: Configure the ALB to use an SSL/TLS policy only for HTTPS traffic.
options.message: Incorrect. Configuring an SSL/TLS policy only for HTTPS does not redirect HTTP traffic. A redirection is needed.

options.option: Update the ALB settings to allow only HTTPS connections.
options.message: Incorrect. Updating the settings to allow only HTTPS connections does not redirect existing HTTP traffic; it only blocks HTTP connections.

options.option: Add a security rule that blocks all HTTP traffic.
options.message: Incorrect. Adding a security rule that blocks HTTP does not redirect the traffic; it only prevents access to HTTP traffic.

en.question: A company needs the ability to analyze the log files of its proprietary application. The logs are stored in JSON format in an Amazon S3 bucket. The queries will be simple and run on demand. A solutions architect needs to perform the analysis with minimal changes to the existing architecture. What should the solutions architect do to meet these requirements with the least operational overhead?

options.option: Use Amazon Athena directly with Amazon S3 to run queries as needed.
options.message: Correct. Using Amazon Athena allows direct querying of data in S3 with SQL queries without the need for ETL or data loading, meeting the requirements for minimal overhead and existing architecture.

options.option: Use Amazon Redshift to load all content into one place and run SQL queries as needed.
options.message: Incorrect. Loading logs into Amazon Redshift may be an effective solution but increases complexity and operational overhead, which does not meet the need for minimal changes to the existing architecture.

options.option: Use Amazon CloudWatch Logs to store the logs. Run SQL queries as needed in the Amazon CloudWatch console.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon CloudWatch Logs is not optimized for querying large volumes of JSON data stored in S3 and does not meet the requirements of a simple and straightforward solution.

options.option: Use AWS Glue to catalog the logs. Use a transient Apache Spark cluster on Amazon EMR to run SQL queries as needed.
options.message: Incorrect. While the combination of AWS Glue and Apache Spark offers processing power, it adds complexity and requires additional setup, which does not meet the requirement for minimal changes to the architecture.

en.question: A company is migrating its marketing website and content management system from an on-premises data center to AWS. The company wants the AWS application to be deployed in a VPC with Amazon EC2 instances used for the web servers and an Amazon RDS instance for the database. The company has a runbook document that describes the process for installing the system on-premises. The company would like to base the AWS system on the processes referenced in the runbook document. The runbook document describes the installation and configuration of operating systems, network configurations, the site, and the content management system software on the servers. After the migration is complete, the company wants to make changes quickly to take advantage of other AWS features. How can the application and environment be deployed and automated on AWS with the LEAST operational overhead while allowing for future changes?

options.option: Write an AWS CloudFormation template that creates the VPC, EC2 instances, and RDS instance for the application. Include EC2 user data in the AWS CloudFormation template to install and configure the software.
options.message: Correct. The CloudFormation and Amazon EC2 user data scripts are the best option. You can utilize stack updates to deploy multiple versions of the template to change the environment in the future.

options.option: Write a Python script that uses the AWS API to create the VPC, EC2 instances, and RDS instance for the application. Write shell scripts to implement the remaining steps in the runbook. Have the Python script copy and execute the shell scripts on the newly created instances to complete the installation.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution includes some automation, but a Python script is not the best choice. It would require considerable effort to create the script. A Python script would require greater operational overhead to handle future environment updates than a CloudFormation template.

options.option: Write an AWS CloudFormation template that creates the VPC, EC2 instances, and RDS instance for the application. Ensure that the remaining steps in the runbook are updated to reflect any changes that might come from the AWS migration.
options.message: Incorrect. The CloudFormation template will help create an automated solution. However, the installation and configuration of the software are still manual.

options.option: Update the runbook to describe how to create the VPC, EC2 instances, and RDS instance for the application using the AWS Console. Ensure that the remaining steps in the runbook are updated to reflect any changes that might come from the AWS migration.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution does not include significant automation. It would be difficult to change the environment to utilize other services if needed.

en.question: A company uses NFS to store large video files on on-premises network-attached storage. Each video file varies in size from 1 MB to 500 GB. The total storage is 70 TB and is no longer growing. The company decides to migrate the video files to Amazon S3. The company must migrate the video files as quickly as possible using the least network bandwidth. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Set up an AWS Direct Connect connection between the on-premises network and AWS. Deploy an S3 File Gateway on-premises. Create a public virtual interface (VIF) to connect to the S3 File Gateway. Create an S3 bucket. Create a new NFS file share on the S3 File Gateway. Point the new file share to the S3 bucket. Transfer the data from the existing NFS file share to the S3 File Gateway.
options.message: Incorrect. While Direct Connect provides high bandwidth and low latency, it is not the fastest and most efficient option to quickly transfer large volumes of data with the least network bandwidth.

options.option: Create an S3 bucket. Create an IAM role with permissions to write to the S3 bucket. Use the AWS CLI to copy all files locally to the S3 bucket.
options.message: Incorrect. Using the AWS CLI to copy files directly may consume a lot of bandwidth and time, especially for 70 TB of data, making the transfer slow.

options.option: Create an AWS Snowball Edge job. Receive a Snowball Edge device on-premises. Use the Snowball Edge client to transfer data to the device. Return the device so that AWS can import the data into Amazon S3.
options.message: Correct. Using AWS Snowball Edge is ideal for quickly transferring large volumes of data using the least network bandwidth possible, making it suitable for the company's requirements.

options.option: Deploy an S3 File Gateway on-premises. Create a public service endpoint to connect to the S3 File Gateway. Create an S3 bucket. Create a new NFS file share on the S3 File Gateway. Point the new file share to the S3 bucket. Transfer the data from the existing NFS file share to the S3 File Gateway.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution requires a complex on-premises setup and uses network bandwidth to transfer data, which may not be the most efficient and fastest way.

en.question: A company recently migrated to AWS and wants to implement a solution to secure the traffic entering and leaving the production VPC. The company had an inspection server in its on-premises data center. The inspection server performed specific operations such as traffic flow inspection and traffic filtering. The company wants to have the same functionalities in the AWS Cloud. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Use Traffic Mirroring to mirror traffic from the production VPC for traffic inspection and filtering.
options.message: Incorrect. Traffic Mirroring does not perform active traffic filtering; it only sends copies of traffic for analysis.

options.option: Use AWS Network Firewall to create the necessary rules for traffic inspection and traffic filtering for the production VPC.
options.message: Correct. AWS Network Firewall provides traffic inspection and filtering with customizable rules similar to the on-premises inspection server.

options.option: Use AWS Firewall Manager to create the necessary rules for traffic inspection and traffic filtering for the production VPC.
options.message: Incorrect. AWS Firewall Manager manages firewall rules but does not directly inspect and filter traffic.

options.option: Use Amazon GuardDuty for traffic inspection and traffic filtering in the production VPC.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon GuardDuty provides threat detection services but does not directly inspect and filter traffic.

en.question: A company is hosting a static website on Amazon S3 and is using Amazon Route 53 for DNS. The site is experiencing increased demand from around the world. Which solution meets these requirements most cost-effectively?

options.option: Replicate the S3 bucket to all AWS regions. Add Route 53 geolocation routing entries.
options.message: Incorrect. Replicating the S3 bucket and geolocation routing is not as cost-effective as using CloudFront. Replication can increase costs, and geolocation configuration is complex.

options.option: Add an Amazon CloudFront distribution in front of the S3 bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the CloudFront distribution.
options.message: Correct. Adding an Amazon CloudFront distribution is the most cost-effective and efficient solution for reducing global latency, as CloudFront is a CDN that caches content and delivers it from locations closer to users.

options.option: Provision accelerators in AWS Global Accelerator. Associate the provided IP addresses with the S3 bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the accelerator IP addresses.
options.message: Incorrect. AWS Global Accelerator is more expensive and complex than CloudFront for this case. It is more appropriate for improving overall network connectivity, not for delivering static content.

options.option: Enable S3 Transfer Acceleration on the bucket. Edit the Route 53 entries to point to the new endpoint.
options.message: Incorrect. S3 Transfer Acceleration can improve upload and download performance but does not offer the same global latency and caching benefits as CloudFront.

en.question: A company has an application that provides marketing services to stores. The stores upload transaction data to the company via SFTP, and the data is processed to generate new marketing offers. Some files can exceed 200 GB. The company found that some stores uploaded files with personally identifiable information (PII) that should not be there. How can a solutions architect meet these requirements with the least development effort?

options.option: Implement custom scanning algorithms in an AWS Lambda function. Trigger the function when objects are uploaded to the bucket. If the objects contain PII, use the Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) to trigger a notification to administrators to remove objects that contain PII.
options.message: Correct. This solution is suitable because it combines AWS Lambda for real-time processing with SNS for notification, ensuring administrators are alerted about the presence of PII.

options.option: Implement custom scanning algorithms in an AWS Lambda function. Trigger the function when objects are uploaded to the bucket. If the objects contain PII, use the Amazon Simple Email Service (Amazon SES) to send a notification to administrators and trigger an S3 lifecycle policy to remove the files that contain PII.
options.message: Incorrect. SES can be used for notifications, but the S3 lifecycle policy is not ideal for automated removal of objects with PII after upload. It is more appropriate to use SNS for notifications and implement removal logic in Lambda.

options.option: Use an Amazon S3 bucket as a secure transfer point. Use Amazon Macie to check the objects in the bucket. If the objects contain PII, use the Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) to trigger a notification to administrators to remove the objects that contain PII.
options.message: Correct. Amazon Macie is ideal for identifying PII in data stored in S3, and when combined with SNS for notification, it can automate the process of alerting administrators about the presence of PII.

options.option: Use an Amazon S3 bucket as a secure transfer point. Use Amazon Inspector to check the objects in the bucket. If the objects contain PII, trigger an S3 lifecycle policy to remove the objects that contain PII.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon Inspector is not the right tool for checking file contents for PII. Macie is the most appropriate option for this type of data analysis.

en.question: A company needs to run a large number of containers in production and wants to use an orchestration service that allows for easy scalability and integration with other AWS services. The company also wants to optimize costs by using spot instances whenever possible. Which solution best meets these requirements?

options.option: Use Amazon ECS with AWS Fargate to manage all containers.
options.message: Incorrect. While Fargate simplifies container management, it does not allow the use of spot instances, which are needed to optimize costs.

options.option: Use Kubernetes on EC2 (EKS) with auto-scaling enabled.
options.message: Incorrect. EKS offers excellent integration and scalability, but the use of spot instances with auto-scaling is more directly supported by ECS in terms of cost-effectiveness.

options.option: Use Amazon ECS with EC2 instances and enable spot instances.
options.message: Correct. This is the correct option because it allows the use of spot instances for cost optimization, integrates easily with AWS services, and supports scalability.

options.option: Use EC2 instances with Docker Compose to orchestrate the containers.
options.message: Incorrect. Docker Compose is not ideal for orchestrating a large number of containers in production and does not offer the same scalability and integration with AWS.

en.question: What is the main advantage of using AWS Secrets Manager compared to storing credentials in local configuration files?

options.option: Ease of integration with EC2 instances.
options.message: Incorrect. Although Secrets Manager can be integrated with EC2, the main advantage is automatic credential rotation.
Incorrect. Cost is not the main advantage of Secrets Manager. The main advantage is the automated and secure credential management.
Correct. AWS Secrets Manager provides automatic credential rotation, which helps maintain security and reduce operational overhead.

options.option: Improved security with encryption in transit and at rest.
options.message: Incorrect. While Secrets Manager offers encryption, the main advantage is automatic credential rotation.

en.question: To ensure AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) works properly with the self-managed Active Directory, which configuration is essential?

options.option: Enable AWS SSO in each account individually.
options.message: Incorrect. AWS SSO should be enabled centrally and not in each account individually to work correctly with Active Directory.

options.option: Configure a trust relationship between AWS SSO and Active Directory.
options.message: Correct. Configuring an appropriate trust relationship between AWS SSO and Active Directory is essential to ensure SSO works correctly.

options.option: Use AWS IAM groups to manage access permissions.
options.message: Incorrect. IAM groups do not replace the need for a proper trust relationship between AWS SSO and Active Directory.

options.option: Enable access logs in AWS CloudTrail for monitoring.
options.message: Incorrect. Enabling access logs is a good practice but does not replace the necessary configuration to integrate AWS SSO with Active Directory.

en.question: A company runs an e-commerce application on Amazon EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer. The instances run in an Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling group across multiple availability zones. The Auto Scaling group scales based on CPU utilization metrics. The e-commerce application stores transaction data in a MySQL 8.0 database hosted on a large EC2 instance. The database performance degrades rapidly as the application load increases. The application handles more read requests than write transactions. The company wants a solution that automatically scales the database to meet the demand for unpredictable read workloads while maintaining high availability. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Use Amazon ElastiCache for Memcached with EC2 spot instances.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon ElastiCache is a caching solution that can improve read performance but is not a solution for automatic database scalability and does not guarantee high availability by itself.

options.option: Use Amazon Redshift with a single node for leader and computing functionality.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon Redshift is a data warehousing service, not suitable for OLTP workloads and does not meet the scalability needs for reads on the transactional database.

options.option: Use Amazon RDS with a Single-AZ deployment. Configure Amazon RDS to add reader instances in a different availability zone.
options.message: Incorrect. While using reader instances can help with read scalability, the Single-AZ deployment does not guarantee high availability and can be a critical limitation.

options.option: Use Amazon Aurora with a Multi-AZ deployment. Configure Aurora Auto Scaling with Aurora replicas.
options.message: Correct. Amazon Aurora with a Multi-AZ deployment and Aurora Auto Scaling with Aurora replicas is suitable for handling unpredictable read workloads and provides high availability.

en.question: A company has an application that ingests incoming messages. Dozens of other applications and microservices rapidly consume these messages. The number of messages varies drastically and sometimes spikes to 100,000 per second. The company wants to decouple the solution and increase scalability. Which solution meets these requirements?

options.option: Write the messages to Amazon Kinesis Data Streams with a single shard. Use an AWS Lambda function to pre-process messages and store them in Amazon DynamoDB. Configure the consumer applications to read from DynamoDB to process the messages.
options.message: Incorrect. A Kinesis Data Stream with a single shard is not sufficient to handle spikes of 100,000 messages per second, and it adds unnecessary complexity by pre-processing with Lambda and storing in DynamoDB.

options.option: Publish the messages to an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic with multiple Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS) subscriptions. Configure the consumer applications to process messages from the queues.
options.message: Correct. Using Amazon SNS with SQS subscriptions allows scaling according to load variation, decoupling message ingestion and processing by different consumer applications.

options.option: Deploy the ingestion application on Amazon EC2 instances in an Auto Scaling group to scale the number of EC2 instances based on CPU metrics.
options.message: Incorrect. Scaling based on CPU metrics may not efficiently handle extreme variability and spikes in message ingestion, and it adds management complexity.

options.option: Persist the messages to Amazon Kinesis Data Analytics. Configure the consumer applications to read and process the messages.
options.message: Incorrect. Kinesis Data Analytics is more suited for continuous real-time analytics and not for the decoupled persistence and consumption of messages by multiple applications.

en.question: A company is migrating applications to AWS. The applications are deployed across different accounts. The company manages the accounts using AWS Organizations. The company's security team needs a single sign-on (SSO) solution across all company accounts. The company must continue managing users and groups in its self-managed Microsoft Active Directory on-premises. What solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Enable AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) in the AWS SSO console. Create a bidirectional forest trust to connect the company's self-managed Microsoft Active Directory to AWS SSO using AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory.
options.message: Incorrect. A bidirectional forest trust is not necessary for this use case and may unnecessarily increase complexity and security risks.

options.option: Deploy an on-premises identity provider (IdP). Enable AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) in the AWS SSO console.
options.message: Incorrect. This option does not properly leverage AWS SSO and introduces additional complexity by implementing a separate identity provider.

options.option: Enable AWS Single Sign-On (AWS SSO) in the AWS SSO console. Create a one-way forest trust or a one-way domain trust to connect the company's self-managed Microsoft Active Directory to AWS SSO using AWS Directory Service for Microsoft Active Directory.
options.message: Correct. This option allows AWS SSO to use the company’s on-premises Microsoft Active Directory for authentication, meeting the SSO requirement without changing user management.

options.option: Use AWS Directory Service. Create a bidirectional trust with the company's self-managed Microsoft Active Directory.
options.message: Incorrect. Creating a bidirectional trust with AWS Directory Service does not implement AWS SSO and does not meet the specific SSO requirement.

en.question: A company wants to migrate its on-premises application to AWS. The application produces output files that vary in size from tens of gigabytes to hundreds of terabytes. The application's data must be stored in a standard file system structure. The company wants a solution that automatically scales, is highly available, and requires minimal operational overhead. Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Migrate the application to run as containers on Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS). Use Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) for storage.
options.message: Incorrect. While Amazon EKS offers scalability, Amazon EBS does not automatically provide a highly available file system with minimal operational overhead.

options.option: Migrate the application to Amazon EC2 instances in a Multi-AZ Auto Scaling group. Use Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) for storage.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon EBS is designed for block storage and does not automatically provide the required availability and scalability as a file system.

options.option: Migrate the application to run as containers on Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS). Use Amazon S3 for storage.
options.message: Incorrect. Amazon S3 is object storage and does not provide a standard file system structure required for this use case.

options.option: Migrate the application to Amazon EC2 instances in a Multi-AZ Auto Scaling group. Use Amazon Elastic File System (Amazon EFS) for storage.
options.message: Correct. Amazon EFS offers a scalable and highly available file system that can be mounted across multiple EC2 instances, meeting the company's requirements.

en.question: To ensure there are no unauthorized changes to S3 bucket configurations, which AWS tool can be set up to continuously evaluate and audit configurations?

options.message: Incorrect. AWS CloudTrail is used to record API calls and user activities but does not evaluate specific bucket configurations.
Correct. AWS Config is the appropriate tool to evaluate and audit resource configurations, including S3 buckets.
Incorrect. AWS Shield is a DDoS protection service and not related to configuration auditing.
Incorrect. AWS WAF is used to protect web applications and not to audit S3 bucket configurations.

en.question: A global company hosts its web application on Amazon EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer (ALB). The web application has both static and dynamic data. The company stores its static data in an Amazon S3 bucket. The company wants to improve performance and reduce latency for both static and dynamic data. The company is using its own domain name registered with Amazon Route 53. What should a solutions architect do to meet these requirements?

options.option: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution with the S3 bucket and the ALB as origins. Configure Route 53 to route traffic to the CloudFront distribution.
options.message: Correct. An Amazon CloudFront distribution with the S3 bucket and the ALB as origins significantly reduces latency for both static and dynamic content.

options.option: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution with the S3 bucket as an origin. Create a standard AWS Global Accelerator with the ALB and the CloudFront distribution as endpoints. Create a custom domain name pointing to the accelerator's DNS name. Use the custom domain name as an endpoint for the web application.
options.message: Incorrect. Combining CloudFront with AWS Global Accelerator adds unnecessary complexity and is not the most efficient solution for reducing latency.

options.option: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution with the ALB as an origin. Create a standard AWS Global Accelerator with the S3 bucket as an endpoint. Create two domain names. Point one domain name to the CloudFront DNS name for dynamic content. Point the other domain name to the accelerator DNS name for static content. Use the domain names as endpoints for the web application.
options.message: Incorrect. Using two domain names adds complexity and is unnecessary when CloudFront can reduce latency for both types of content.

options.option: Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution with the ALB as an origin. Create a standard AWS Global Accelerator with the S3 bucket as an endpoint. Configure Route 53 to route traffic to the CloudFront distribution.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution adds complexity without providing additional benefits compared to using CloudFront for all origins.

en.question: What configuration is necessary to allow the Application Load Balancer (ALB) to automatically redirect HTTP to HTTPS?

options.option: Configure a listener on the ALB to listen on port 80 and redirect to port 443.
options.message: Correct. Configuring a listener on port 80 and redirecting to port 443 is the correct way to ensure HTTP traffic is redirected to HTTPS.

options.option: Enable TLS encryption on the ALB's HTTP listener.
options.message: Incorrect. Enabling TLS encryption on the HTTP listener does not redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. It only applies TLS encryption to HTTP traffic.

options.option: Create a security policy on the ALB that requires HTTPS.
options.message: Incorrect. Creating a security policy does not automatically redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS. It can only restrict access.

options.option: Disable the HTTP listener on the ALB.
options.message: Incorrect. Disabling the HTTP listener does not redirect existing HTTP traffic to HTTPS. A redirection needs to be configured.

en.question: A company performs monthly maintenance on its AWS infrastructure. During these maintenance activities, the company needs to rotate the credentials of its Amazon RDS for MySQL databases across multiple AWS regions. Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?

options.option: Store the credentials as secrets in AWS Systems Manager by creating a secure string parameter. Use multi-region secret replication for the required regions. Configure Systems Manager to rotate the secrets on a schedule.
options.message: Incorrect. AWS Systems Manager is not as well-suited as AWS Secrets Manager for managing and rotating database credentials.

options.option: Store the credentials as secrets in AWS Secrets Manager. Use multi-region secret replication for the required regions. Configure Secrets Manager to rotate the secrets on a schedule.
options.message: Correct. Storing credentials in AWS Secrets Manager with multi-region replication and automatic rotation meets the requirements with the least operational overhead.

options.option: Encrypt the credentials as secrets using multi-region customer-managed keys from AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). Store the secrets in a global Amazon DynamoDB table. Use an AWS Lambda function to retrieve the secrets from DynamoDB. Use the RDS API to rotate the secrets.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution adds excessive complexity and is not the most efficient way to manage and rotate credentials.

options.option: Store the credentials in an Amazon S3 bucket with server-side encryption (SSE) enabled. Use Amazon EventBridge (Amazon CloudWatch Events) to invoke an AWS Lambda function to rotate the credentials.
options.message: Incorrect. Storing credentials in an S3 bucket and using EventBridge and Lambda for rotation adds unnecessary complexity.

en.question: A company collects temperature, humidity, and atmospheric pressure data in cities on several continents. The average volume of data that the company collects from each site daily is 500 GB. Each site has a high-speed internet connection. The company wants to aggregate data from all these global sites as quickly as possible into a single Amazon S3 bucket. The solution must minimize operational complexity. Which solution meets these requirements?

options.option: Upload the data from each site to an S3 bucket in the nearest region. Use S3 cross-region replication to copy objects to the target S3 bucket. Then remove the data from the source S3 bucket.
options.message: Incorrect. Although this solution works, it increases operational complexity due to the need to configure and manage cross-region replication, as well as manage data removal.

options.option: Upload the data from each site to an Amazon EC2 instance in the nearest region. Store the data in an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume. At regular intervals, take an EBS snapshot and copy it to the region containing the target S3 bucket. Restore the EBS volume in that region.
options.message: Incorrect. This solution adds significant operational complexity in managing EC2 instances and EBS volumes, as well as periodic snapshot and restore processes.

options.option: Enable S3 Transfer Acceleration on the target S3 bucket. Use multipart uploads to upload data directly from the site to the target S3 bucket.
options.message: Correct. Enabling S3 Transfer Acceleration and using multipart uploads helps maximize upload speed for large volumes of data while minimizing operational complexity.

options.option: Schedule daily optimized device jobs for AWS Snowball Edge Storage to transfer data from each site to the nearest region. Use S3 cross-region replication to copy objects to the target S3 bucket.
options.message: Incorrect. Using AWS Snowball Edge adds operational complexity in configuring and coordinating devices across multiple geographically distant sites, not well meeting the need to minimize complexity.

en.question: A company wants to optimize data traffic between its EC2 instances and Amazon S3 while avoiding additional charges. Which AWS feature should be used to ensure that traffic between these instances and S3 is free?

options.message: Incorrect. Amazon CloudFront is a CDN service and does not eliminate data transfer fees within the VPC.
Incorrect. AWS Direct Connect is a dedicated connection solution and is not the most economical option for internal VPC traffic.
Correct. The VPC Endpoint for Amazon S3 allows traffic between EC2 and S3 to stay within the AWS network, avoiding data transfer fees.
Incorrect. The Elastic Load Balancer distributes traffic between instances but does not affect data transfer fees to S3.

en.question: A company hosting its web application on AWS wants to ensure that all Amazon EC2 instances, Amazon RDS database instances, and Amazon Redshift clusters are configured with tags. The company wants to minimize the configuration and operational effort for this verification. What should a solutions architect do to achieve this?

options.option: Use the Cost Manager to display resources that are not properly tagged. Manually tag these resources.
options.message: Incorrect. Manually tagging resources via the Cost Manager does not scale well and requires frequent hands-on management, increasing operational effort.

options.option: Write API calls to check all resources for proper tag allocation. Run the code periodically on an EC2 instance.
options.message: Incorrect. Running code periodically on an EC2 instance to check tags requires ongoing administration of the EC2 instance, increasing complexity and effort.

options.option: Use AWS Config rules to define and detect resources that are not properly tagged.
options.message: Correct. AWS Config allows you to define rules to detect improperly tagged resources and automate continuous verification with minimal operational effort.

options.option: Write API calls to check all resources for proper tag allocation. Schedule an AWS Lambda function via Amazon CloudWatch to run the code periodically.
options.message: Incorrect. This approach increases complexity and operational effort as it requires creating and maintaining custom scripts and configuring periodic execution with AWS Lambda and CloudWatch.

en.question: A company provides a VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) service using UDP connections. The service consists of Amazon EC2 instances running in an Auto Scaling group. The company has deployments in multiple AWS regions. The company needs to route users to the region with the lowest latency. The company also requires automated failover between regions. What solution will meet these requirements?

options.option: Deploy a Network Load Balancer (NLB) and an associated target group. Associate the target group with the Auto Scaling group. Create a latency record in Amazon Route 53 that points to aliases for each NLB. Create an Amazon CloudFront distribution that uses the latency record as the origin.
options.message: Incorrect. While NLB is suitable for UDP, combining it with Route 53 and CloudFront increases complexity without providing full automated failover between regions.

options.option: Deploy an Application Load Balancer (ALB) and an associated target group. Associate the target group with the Auto Scaling group. Use the ALB as an endpoint for AWS Global Accelerator in each region.
options.message: Incorrect. The Application Load Balancer (ALB) is not ideal for UDP connections, requiring a solution with native support for this type of connection.

options.option: Deploy a Network Load Balancer (NLB) and an associated target group. Associate the target group with the Auto Scaling group. Use the NLB as an endpoint for AWS Global Accelerator in each region.
